item.title: Amazon Pharmacy to expand same-day delivery to nearly 4,500 US cities
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The expansion will cover customers in newly served states such as Idaho and Massachusetts.

item.title: Build a pipeline and close deals with an exhibit table at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Get an unmatched ROI by exhibiting your startup in front of 10,000 tech leaders and investors at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, October 13-15 in San Francisco. Book your table now before it's gone.

item.title: TikTok launches an opt-in Local Feed in the U.S. leveraging users’ precise location
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: TikTok's new Local Feed will show you nearby shopping, dining, events, news, and more.

item.title: Integrate raises $17M to move defense project management into the 21st century
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round was led by FPV Ventures co-founder and managing partner Wesley Chan.

item.title: Complyance raises $20M to help companies manage risk and compliance
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Complyance raised a $20 million Series A led by GV for its AI-native compliance platform.

item.title: Humanoid robot startup Apptronik has now raised $935M at a $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Apptronik has sold another $520 million in a Series A extension to existing and new investors like Google and Mercedes-Benz.

item.title: Meridian raises $17 million to remake the agentic spreadsheet
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: A new company called Meridian.AI has emerged from stealth with an IDE-based approach to agentic financial modeling.

item.title: Samsung to hold its Galaxy S26 event on February 25
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Samsung is going to launch S26 lineup just before Mobile World Congress (MWC).

item.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

item.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

item.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

item.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.

item.title: An ice dance duo skated to AI music at the Olympics
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Czech ice dancers Katerina Mrazkova and Daniel Mrazek are learning the hard way that LLMs sometimes spit out straight-up plagiarism.

item.title: Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter steps down after 30 years at the company
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Robert Playter announcd he is leaving Boston Dynamics after 30 years at the company in various roles, including six years as CEO.

item.title: VC Masha Bucher, Epstein associate and Day One founder, explains herself
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: After numerous news reports documented Masha Bucher's close business and personal relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Bucher took to X to explain.

item.title: Google sent personal and financial information of student journalist to ICE
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The tech giant handed over the personal information of a journalist and student who attended a pro-Palestinian protest in 2024. This is the latest example of ICE using its controversial subpoena powers to target people critical of the Trump administration.

item.title: Here’s how Rivian changed the rear door manual release on the R2
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Rivian, along with other automakers, has been under pressure to make the manual door releases easier to access. The new R2 SUV does that — here's how.

item.title: Facebook adds new AI features, animated profile photos, and backgrounds for text posts
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Facebook's new AI features let users animate their profile pics, restyle their Stories and Memories, and add backgrounds to text posts.

item.title: Former Tesla product manager wants to make luxury goods impossible to fake, starting with a chip
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The startup claims that it has developed a "hack-proof" chip that can't be bypassed by devices like Flipper Zero, a widely available hacking tool that can be used to tamper with wireless systems. These chips are linked with digital certificates to verify the authenticity of the products.

item.title: Singapore says China-backed hackers targeted its four largest phone companies
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The Singaporean government said the China-backed hackers gained "limited access to critical systems" run by the country's top four telecommunication giants, but said they did not disrupt services or steal customers' data.
